messages.message:
Hi , I tried making a pull request , but if failed the initial travis build,
I had a `docxtpl`  , which is a 3rd party library!
I updated the `distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks/requirements.in` to contain `docxtpl`
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/13815/commits/932f8f89db2d17ea881fb3d255d3d58dfbf51303
Despite updating , the *travis build* fails with
`ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'docxtpl'`
Here is the link to build log https://travis-ci.com/github/instabase/instabase/builds/163959885

I have few doubts as we can see `distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks/Makefile`
There is not any command that runs to update requirements.in (http://requirements.in) file within the same root level directory structure.

How does the travis build install required dependencies?
If I am not wrong I think the travis image needs to rebuilt in these cases, there is a doc explaining how.. I couldn't find it though :grimacing:
@sudeep helped me rebuild it , but it failed which was obvious considering there wasnâ€™t any update on the pull request!
thanks @will, i should have known where to find this :slightly_smiling_face:

@will Tried updating the requirement.base.in (http://requirement.base.in) file , also ran pip compile to make sure the package appears in .txt file.
https://travis-ci.com/github/instabase/instabase/builds/164235719
After that the image needs to updated, built, and PR so it can be used. :slightly_smiling_face: Take a look at the confluence doc I linked and make sure we got all the steps.
Sure I missed on those, I will check back .Thanks:slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks Will! The doc is very helpful
